intro: Pilosella brachycoma, commonly known as the short-hairy mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with a yellow center. Pilosella brachycoma is often found in open habitats and is known for its hardy, low-growing structure.
